titles.title: For the relief of J.L. Simmons Company, Inc., of Champaign, Illinois.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Immigration and Claims.

bill.summary: 12/5/2001--Introduced. Requires the Secretary of the Treasury to pay a sum of money to be determined by the United States Court of Federal Claims to J.L. Simmons Company, Inc. in full satisfaction of all claims of J.L. Simmons, J.L. Simmons Company, Inc., or any of its subcontractors against the United States for any litigation expenses, and any interest, due and owing to them and not otherwise recoverable at law on account of the construction of the Veterans Administration (West Side) Hospital in Chicago, Illinois, between 1949 through 1954, and any resulting litigation of claims.
